ygData.subject: Bug with non-default Python Installation?
ygData.msgSnippet: The default Windows installation for Python is in C: Python23. Because I like to keep my root directory uncluttered, I installed it into C: Program

Subject: Bug with non-default Python Installation?
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=193701270
X-Yahoo-Profile: alankornhauser
X-eGroups-Approved-By: dggoodwin <dgoodwin@...> via web; 30 Jul 2004 21:32:22 -0000
X-eGroups-Remote-IP: 66.218.66.72

The default Windows installation for Python is in C:\Python23.  
Because I like to keep my root directory uncluttered, I installed it 
into C:\Program Files\Python23.

Python worked fine, and I got no error with "from Cantera import *".  
When I ran the flame1.py demo, however, I got an error.  One of the 
subroutines was looking for a file in C:/Python23/....

I reinstalled with Python in the default location and everything now 
seems to be working fine.

Al Kornhauser
